1.name: Singin' in the Rain
1.description: A silent film production company and cast make a difficult transition to sound.

2.name: High Noon
2.description: A town Marshal, despite the disagreements of his newlywed bride and the townspeople around him, must face a gang of deadly killers alone at high noon when the gang leader, an outlaw he sent up years ago, arrives on the noon train.

3.name: Ikiru
3.description: A bureaucrat tries to find a meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.

4.name: The Quiet Man
4.description: A retired American boxer returns to the village of his birth in Ireland, where he finds love.

5.name: Love Is Better Than Ever
5.description: The dancing teacher Anastasia falls in love with the smart theatre agent Jud. He likes her, too, but does not want to give up his solo life at all. Thus she plans a trap for him...

6.name: Lone Star
6.description: Ex-President Andrew Jackson sends Texan Devereaux Burke back home on a mission to facilitate Sam Houston's drive for U.S. statehood.

7.name: The Greatest Show on Earth
7.description: The dramatic lives of trapeze artists, a clown, and an elephant trainer are told against a background of circus spectacle.

8.name: My Cousin Rachel
8.description: A young man plots revenge against the woman he believes murdered his cousin, but his plans are shaken when he comes face to face with the enigmatic beauty.

9.name: Limelight
9.description: A fading comedian and a suicidally despondent ballet dancer must look to each other to find meaning and hope in their lives.

10.name: The Sound Barrier
10.description: Fictionalized story of British aerospace engineers solving the problem of supersonic flight.

11.name: Moulin Rouge
11.description: Fictional account of French artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec.

12.name: Viva Zapata!
12.description: The story of Mexican revolutionary Emiliano Zapata, who led a rebellion against the corrupt, oppressive dictatorship of president Porfirio Diaz in the early 20th century.

13.name: The Bad and the Beautiful
13.description: An unscrupulous movie producer uses an actress, a director and a writer to achieve success.

14.name: The Snows of Kilimanjaro
14.description: Writer Harry Street reflects on his life as he lies dying from an infection while on safari in the shadow of Mount Kilamanjaro.

15.name: Sudden Fear
15.description: After an ambitious actor insinuates himself into the life of a wealthy middle-aged playwright and marries her, he plots with his mistress to murder her.

16.name: The Duel at Silver Creek
16.description: Marshal Tyrone and the Silver Kid form an uneasy alliance against a gang of claim jumpers.

17.name: The Crimson Pirate
17.description: During the 1700s, pirate Captain Vallo seizes a British warship and gets involved in various money-making schemes involving Caribbean rebels led by El Libre, British envoy Baron Jose Gruda, and a beautiful courtesan named Consuelo.

18.name: Clash by Night
18.description: Mae Doyle comes back to her hometown a cynical woman. Her brother Joe fears that his love, fish cannery worker Peggy, may wind up like Mae. Mae marries Jerry and has a baby; she is happy but restless, drawn to Jerry's friend Earl.

19.name: Ivanhoe
19.description: A knight seeks to free the captive King Richard and put him back on the throne.

20.name: Phone Call from a Stranger
20.description: While waiting on a delayed flight, David Trask, who has left his unfaithful wife, meets three of his fellow passengers. When the aircraft crashes, he is one of few survivors, and sets out to resolve their unfinished business.

21.name: Umberto D.
21.description: An elderly man and his dog struggle to survive on his government pension in Rome.

22.name: Don't Bother to Knock
22.description: After being dumped by his girlfriend, an airline pilot pursues a babysitter in his hotel and gradually realizes she's dangerous.

23.name: Son of Ali Baba
23.description: Kashma Baba, the son of the famed Baghdad thief Ali Baba is a cadet in a medieval Persian military academy where he runs afoul of his rival Hussein, the evil Caliph's son.

24.name: Bend of the River
24.description: When a town boss confiscates homesteader's supplies after gold is discovered nearby, a tough cowboy risks his life to try and get it to them.

25.name: The Battle at Apache Pass
25.description: When Cochise bands together with Geronimo and other Indian tribes, Major Colton abandons his fort, heading towards Fort Sheridan, through Apache Pass. The only thing in his way are the Indians he used to call his friends.

26.name: Monkey Business
26.description: A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth.

27.name: Son of Paleface
27.description: Junior Potter returns to claim his father's gold, which is nowhere to be found. "Mike" is the luscious head of a gang of thieves, and Roy Barton is the federal marshal hot on her trail.

28.name: Kansas City Confidential
28.description: An ex-con trying to go straight is framed for a million dollar armored car robbery and must go to Mexico in order to unmask the real culprits.

29.name: 5 Fingers
29.description: During WWII the valet to the British Ambassador to Ankara sells British secrets to the Germans while trying to romance a refugee Polish countess.

30.name: The Half-Breed
30.description: There is a fortune in gold on Apache land, and Archer, a dirty politician, intends to have it. Things reach the boiling point, but Young, a slick gambler, comes along and saves the day.

31.name: Scaramouche
31.description: In France during the late 18th Century, a man sets out to avenge the death of his friend at the hands of a master swordsman.

32.name: The Planter's Wife
32.description: During the 1950s, in British-controlled Malaya, rubber-tree planters face many difficulties and dangers, including bandit attacks and nationalist guerrilla ambushes.

33.name: The Story of Robin Hood and His Merrie Men
33.description: With King Richard away at the crusades, Prince John rules England with an iron fist and tasks the Sheriff of Nottingham with the collection of high taxes and the capture of outlaw Robin Hood.

34.name: Gift Horse
34.description: In 1940, the Captain of an old Royal Navy destroyer struggles with his crew, as well as the Nazis.

35.name: Retreat, Hell!
35.description: The saga of a battalion of U.S. Marines during the Korean War, starting with their training, landing at Inchon in 1950, advance into North Korea and their subsequent retreat back to the 38th parallel.

36.name: Road to Bali
36.description: Two unemployed show-biz pals accept treasure-diving work in Bali for a local princess and they find treasure, love and trouble.

37.name: The Big Sky
37.description: The success of the journey focuses on keeping the Indian girl alive as well as themselves to complete trade with the Blackfeet.

38.name: Ochazuke no aji
38.description: A childless middle-aged couple faces a marital crisis.

39.name: Come Back, Little Sheba
39.description: An emotionally remote recovering alcoholic and his dowdy, unambitious wife face a personal crisis when they take in an attractive lodger.

40.name: The Importance of Being Earnest
40.description: When Algernon discovers that his friend, Ernest, has created a fictional brother for whenever he needs a reason to escape dull country life, Algernon poses as the brother, resulting in ever increasing confusion.

41.name: Hans Christian Andersen
41.description: The opening scene of the movie describes it best: "Once upon a time there lived in Denmark a great storyteller named Hans Christian Andersen. This is not the story of his life, but a fairy tale about the great spinner of fairy tales."

42.name: Jack and the Beanstalk
42.description: Abbott & Costello's version of the famous fairy tale, about a young boy who trades the family cow for magic beans.

43.name: Jeux interdits
43.description: A young French girl orphaned in a Nazi air attack is befriended by the son of a poor farmer, and together they try to come to terms with the realities of death.

44.name: Venetian Bird
44.description: Travelling to Venice to locate an ex-partisan, in behalf of a French insurance company, a British private detective gets mixed-up in a political assassination conspiracy.

45.name: Manina, la fille sans voiles
45.description: When a 25-year old Parisian student, Gérard Morere, hears a lecture about a treasure Troilus lost at sea after the Peloponnesian War, he thinks he knows where it is, thanks to a discovery ...                See full summary »

46.name: O. Henry's Full House
46.description: John Steinbeck introduces a quintet of five of O. Henry's most celebrated stories from his New York Period (1902-1910) in this anthology film.

47.name: Affair in Trinidad
47.description: Nightclub singer and her brother-in-law try to find her husband's killer.

48.name: Home at Seven
48.description: David Preston, a bank official goes missing for twenty-four hours and has no memory of the lost time, but when he learns that the steward of his local club has implicated him in a robbery, ...                See full summary »

49.name: Deadline - U.S.A.
49.description: With his newspaper about to be sold, crusading editor Ed Hutcheson tries to complete an exposé on gangster Rienzi.

50.name: Radar Men from the Moon
50.description: Strategic targets on Earth are being destroyed by an unknown weapon. Government security head Henderson suspects it's an "atomic ray" originating from the moon! He assigns Commando Cody, ...                See full summary »
